task.title: Define a Dataset
task.shortdesc: Define a new dataset on the Manage Datasets page.

prereq.note: Only users with a role of can define datasets.

step.cmd: Open the Manage Datasets page, by clicking the Datasets icon in the left navigation bar.

info.p: The Manage Datasets page opens, listing the datasets that have already been defined.

step.cmd: Click the Define New Dataset button.
step.info: The Build New Dataset screen opens.

chdesc.p: Mandatory. A name for the dataset.
Mandatory. A brief description of the dataset.
Optional. The format required by the system to receive the dataset. Supported values are as follows:
If you choose JDBC as the format, you have the option of selecting one of the dataset destinations that has been configured for the system. Tell me about dataset destinations.

chrow.chdesc: Optional. The access policy to protect the dataset. The access policy selected for the dataset may match or may be different from any applied to the constituent data collection(s). By default, the first configured access policy is applied.
Optional. The availability of the dataset. The only supported value is Available.

Mandatory. The users who are allowed to access this dataset. Select one or more users from the drop-down list; only users with a role of Data Analyst appear on the list. By default, no users are allowed to access the dataset.
Mandatory. An expiry date for the dataset. When this date is reached, deletes the dataset from the system.

step.cmd: Choose the fields you want in the dataset.

info.p: You select the fields for the dataset in the Dataset Contents pane. This pane will show a number of tabs; these tabs reflect the data categories configured for your data. Clicking a tab will list all the fields extracted from all the data collections within the category, where each data collection is represented by a column. Each data source and each field has a checkbox.

ul.li: Select an entire data collection by checking the checkbox for the column.
Select any number of individual fields.

info.p: Continue for each data category you want to include in the dataset.
As you select fields, a preview of your selections appears in Export Preview pane.

step.cmd: When your dataset is complete, click the Save Dataset button. The system confirms when the dataset has been successfully saved. Click Close to dismiss the Build New Dataset screen.
